(Digital Ghost) Malware Infection.name: (Digital Ghost) Malware Infection
(Digital Ghost) Malware Infection.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The digital ghost attempts to infect an item with the tech trait being held or used by a creature within 30 feet. The bearer can attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The item is unaffected, and the digital ghost can't use Malware Infection for 1 week.

Success The item is unaffected.

Failure The item becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{Glitching 2}.

Critical Failure The item becomes glitching 2, and an offline digital ghost based on the bearer is created on the device in [[/gmr 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days}.

(Digital Ghost) Virtual Arms.name: (Digital Ghost) Virtual Arms
(Digital Ghost) Virtual Arms.description: A digital ghost's weapons deal mental damage, have the ghost killer upgrade, and disappear if dropped.

(Environmental Adaptation) Temperature A.name: (Environmental Adaptation) Temperature Adaptation
(Environmental Adaptation) Temperature A.description: The creature treats environmental temperature effects as if they were one step less extreme (incredible heat becomes extreme, extreme heat becomes severe, and so on).

(Environmental Adaptation) Terrain Adapt.name: (Environmental Adaptation) Terrain Adaptation
(Environmental Adaptation) Terrain Adapt.description: The creature ignores uneven ground and difficult terrain caused by the most prevalent terrain in its environment, such as snowy terrain on a frigid moon (reducing greater difficult terrain to ordinary difficult terrain).

(Hardlight) Tethered.name: (Hardlight) Tethered
(Hardlight) Tethered.description: A hardlight life-form can't travel more than the indicated number of feet from its projector. A hardlight life-form reduced to 0 HP vanishes, though its projector reconstructs it in [[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}. The only way to permanently destroy a hardlight life-form is to find its projector and either repair or destroy it.

(Infiltrator Robot) Integrated Infiltrat.name: (Infiltrator Robot) Integrated Infiltration Gear
(Infiltrator Robot) Integrated Infiltrat.description: The robot has an integrated @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.coJUVZGcuVg3FoYh]{Infiltrator's Toolkit (Commercial)} (or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.ao5MC3I1b4Gx9LNC]{Infiltrator's Toolkit (Tactical)} if it's at least 7th level) and an integrated @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.qqjDcCW118ySAlAS]{Hacking Toolkit (Commercial)} (or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.5o7wOnkxEsyBwBNj]{Hacking Toolkit (Tactical)} if it's at least 7th level, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.equipment.Item.dk4qkf4BF7wCPV4u]{Hacking Toolkit (Advanced)} if it's at least 9th level).

(Infiltrator Robot) Reactive Camouflage.name: (Infiltrator Robot) Reactive Camouflage
(Infiltrator Robot) Reactive Camouflage.description: The robot comes packaged with photosensitive reflectors on its exterior panels. It can [[/act hide]] even without cover or concealment.

(Magical) Magical Resilience.name: (Magical) Magical Resilience
(Magical) Magical Resilience.description:
Trigger The creature attempts a saving throw against a spell or magical effect of its magical tradition but hasn't rolled yet

Effect The creature gains a +1 circumstance bonus to its saving throw against the triggering effect.

(Nanite) Compression.name: (Nanite) Compression
(Nanite) Compression.description: The creature can move through a gap at least 2 feet wide without Squeezing and can Squeeze through a gap at least 1 foot wide.

(Nanite) Nanite Surge.name: (Nanite) Nanite Surge
(Nanite) Nanite Surge.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The creature restores 6 Hit Points per level (@Damage[(@actor.level*6)[healing]]) to one creature or item with the tech trait.

(Necrovite) Clear Mind.name: (Necrovite) Clear Mind
(Necrovite) Clear Mind.description:
Trigger The necrovite is targeted by a spell with the emotion trait

Effect The necrovite attempts to counteract the triggering spell. If the spell is disrupted, the necrovite gains temporary Hit Points equal to twice the rank of the counteracted spell that last for 1 minute.

(Necrovite) Decompose.name: (Necrovite) Decompose
(Necrovite) Decompose.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The necrovite makes a wrackstaff Strike against a creature. If the attack hits and deals damage, the creature takes @Damage[3d6[persistent,void]] damage.

(Necrovite) Entropic Touch.name: (Necrovite) Entropic Touch
(Necrovite) Entropic Touch.description: Void damage dealt by a necrovite damages undead and creatures with void healing as if it were vitality damage. A necrovite's melee Strikes have the benefits of the ghost killer upgrade on attacks against incorporeal undead.

(Necrovite) Fatiguing Presence.name: (Necrovite) Fatiguing Presence
(Necrovite) Fatiguing Presence.description: 30 feet. A creature that first enters the aura must succeed at a Fortitude save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the necrovite's fatiguing presence for 24 hours.

(Necrovite) Keeper of the Old Ways.name: (Necrovite) Keeper of the Old Ways
(Necrovite) Keeper of the Old Ways.description:
30 feet. Creatures with the tech trait and creatures holding a weapon with the tech trait that begin their turn in the aura must attempt a Fortitude save. The creature is then temporarily immune to the aura for 1 hour.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{glitching 1}.

Critical Failure The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{glitching 2}.

(Necrovite) Rejuvenation.name: (Necrovite) Rejuvenation
(Necrovite) Rejuvenation.description: When a necrovite is destroyed, their consciousness is immediately transferred to their electroencephalon. A necrovite can be permanently destroyed only if their electroencephalon is found and destroyed.

(Necrovite) Scramble Psyche.name: (Necrovite) Scramble Psyche
(Necrovite) Scramble Psyche.description: The necrovite touches an adjacent creature and scrambles its thought patterns. The creature must succeed at a Will save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute. The necrovite is considered @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to the confused target for as long as the confusion lasts.

(Necrovite) Smother the Light.name: (Necrovite) Smother the Light
(Necrovite) Smother the Light.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the necrovite begins to Cast a Spell that has the light or vitality trait

Effect The necrovite attempts to counteract the triggering spell.

(Necrovite) Undying Vigor.name: (Necrovite) Undying Vigor
(Necrovite) Undying Vigor.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect A necrovite infuses an undead creature within 50 feet with a surge of void energy. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 minute. The empowered undead can use this extra action only to Stride or Strike.

(Nymph Queen) Astronomical Ties.name: (Nymph Queen) Astronomical Ties
(Nymph Queen) Astronomical Ties.description: A nymph queen is intrinsically tied to a specific celestial body, such as a supergiant star for a heliad queen. As long as the queen is healthy, her territory thrives, and she can attempt to counteract spells and rituals that alter its physical properties using her spell attack roll with a counteract rank equal to the highest-rank spell she can cast. If a nymph queen is injured or unhealthy, however, her celestial body also weakens: asteroids wobble out of orbit, stars dim, and the gravity of black holes diminishes. Restoring the nymph queen returns her celestial body to its equilibrium.

(Nymph Queen) Broadcast Allure.name: (Nymph Queen) Broadcast Allure
(Nymph Queen) Broadcast Allure.description: The nymph queen magically superimposes her image on all technological items capable of displaying it, such as datapads or comm units, within planetary range. Alternatively, she can send this image to any comm address or addresses that she knows. Each creature that can see the image must succeed at a Will save against the nymph queen's spell DC or have their attitude toward her improve by one step (two steps on a critical failure). Affected creatures' attitudes revert to their previous level if the nymph queen uses a hostile action against them or their allies.

(Nymph Queen) Celestial Step.name: (Nymph Queen) Celestial Step
(Nymph Queen) Celestial Step.description: A nymph queen can traverse her celestial body near-instantaneously. A nymph queen can use Celestial Step to teleport to any area on or within her territory, vanishing into its surface and reemerging at her intended destination.

(Nymph Queen) Fan Mail.name: (Nymph Queen) Fan Mail
(Nymph Queen) Fan Mail.description: A nymph queen can inspire a single intelligent creature by sending them a motivational video or text message. As long as the creature keeps the message saved and remains in good standing with the nymph queen, they gain a +1 status bonus to all Crafting, Performance, and Lore checks related to art or performance. As a 1-action Interact action, the creature can play or view the message to bolster their spirits. Doing so allows the creature to attempt a counteract check against a single emotion effect affecting them, using the nymph queen's spell attack modifier. When the nymph queen's message is used in this way, it becomes a mundane video or text afterward.

(Rendworm Host) Rendworm Eruption.name: (Rendworm Host) Rendworm Eruption
(Rendworm Host) Rendworm Eruption.description: When a rendworm host is reduced to 0 Hit Points by anything other than fire damage, its body ruptures, spawning a number of rendworms equal to half its level, rounded down.

(Rendworm Host) Self-Destructive Frenzy.name: (Rendworm Host) Self-Destructive Frenzy
(Rendworm Host) Self-Destructive Frenzy.description:
Requirements The rendworm host isn't @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} or already in a frenzy

Trigger The rendworm host takes damage

Effect The rendworm host gains the confused condition in a frenzy that lasts for 3 rounds. While confused, the rendworm host gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, a +2 circumstance bonus to damage rolls, and a â€“2 circumstance penalty to AC. The rendworm host can't voluntarily stop this frenzy.

(Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Alp.name: (Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Alpha
(Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Alp.description: The remote war machine Steps or Strides, then makes two Strikes against the same target. Both Strikes count toward its multiple attack penalty, but its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes both Strikes.

(Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Bet.name: (Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Beta
(Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Bet.description: The remote war machine makes a Strike against a target, then Steps or Strides and makes a Strike against another target within range. Both Strikes count toward its multiple attack penalty, but its multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes both Strikes.

(Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Del.name: (Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Delta
(Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Del.description: The remote war machine Strides twice and then Strikes.

(Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Gam.name: (Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Gamma
(Robotic War Machine) Attack Pattern Gam.description: The remote war machine makes three Strikes against any combination of targets. Each Strike gains the agile trait, and each Strike counts toward its multiple attack penalty.

(Robotic War Machine) BVR Engagement.name: (Robotic War Machine) BVR Engagement
(Robotic War Machine) BVR Engagement.description: The remote war machine makes a ranged Strike at a target as though its weapon had double its normal range. This Strike ignores all forms of concealment and cover.

(Robotic War Machine) Ballistic Defense.name: (Robotic War Machine) Ballistic Defense Matrix
(Robotic War Machine) Ballistic Defense.description:
Trigger A creature attempts a ranged Strike against the remote war machine

Requirements The war machine is currently outside the creature's reach

Effect The remote war machine makes a ranged Strike against the triggering creature. If the result of this Strike is equal to or greater than the result of the triggering Strike, the triggering Strike is treated as though it were a critical miss.

(Robotic War Machine) Notch Position.name: (Robotic War Machine) Notch Position
(Robotic War Machine) Notch Position.description:
Trigger An enemy Strides

Requirements The remote war machine is outside the target's reach

Effect The remote war machine Strides up to its Speed in the same direction as the target until the target stops moving or the war machine has moved its full Speed.

(Security Robot) Exigency.name: (Security Robot) Exigency
(Security Robot) Exigency.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Trigger A creature targets the security robot with an attack

Effect The robot overclocks its processing power to attempt to avoid an attack, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to its AC against the triggering attack.

(Security Robot) Fire Suppressor.name: (Security Robot) Fire Suppressor
(Security Robot) Fire Suppressor.description: The robot sprays a torrent of water that functions as @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.jfVCuOpzC6mUrf6f]{Hydraulic Push}. The robot must refill its tanks after using this ability.

(Security Robot) Nanite Surge.name: (Security Robot) Nanite Surge
(Security Robot) Nanite Surge.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The security robot restores 6 Hit Points per the robot's level (@Damage[(@actor.level*6)[healing]]) to one technological creature or item.

(Warped) Not Really There.name: (Warped) Not Really There
(Warped) Not Really There.description:
Trigger A creature targets the warped creature with an attack or area effect, and the warped creature is aware of the attacker

Effect The warped creature teleports 10 feet. If this puts the warped creature out of the range or area of the attack, the attack misses. If not, the warped creature gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and Reflex saves against the attack.

(Warped) Unsettling.name: (Warped) Unsettling
(Warped) Unsettling.description: 20 feet. A creature that enters the aura must succeed at a Will save or become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure) and is then temporarily immune for 1 minute. Use the creature's spell DC or the DC of one of its existing abilities (whichever is highest), or set a DC based on the creature's level.
